greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of integers one less than a prime encountered before reaching (n^2)-1 when starting from k = ((n+1)^2)-1 and iterating map k -> k - A002828(k).
comment: Only 325 cases in range n=1..10000 where a(n) >= A277486(n). See also comments in A277487.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n=6, we start iterating from k = ((6+1)^2)-1 = 48, and then 48 - A002828(48) = 45, 45 - A002828(45) = 43, 43 - A002828(43) = 40, 40 - A002828(40) = 38, and 38 - A002828(38) = 35 (which is 6^2 - 1), and when we add one to each, only 41 is prime, thus a(6) = 1.
program: istwo(n:int)=my(f); if(n<3, return(n>=0); ); f=factor(n>>valuation(n, 2)); for(i=1, #f[, 1], if(bitand(f[i, 2], 1)==1&&bitand(f[i, 1], 3)==3, return(0))); 1
A002828(n)=if(issquare(n), !!n, if(istwo(n), 2, 4-isthree(n))) \\ From _Charles R Greathouse_ IV, Jul 19 2011
A277488(n) = { my(orgk = ((n+1)^2)-1); my(k = orgk, s = 0); while(((k == orgk) || !issquare(1+k)), s = s + if(isprime(1+k),1,0); k = k - A002828(k)); s; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 08 2016
